hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding His saying (may He be exalted) 'The fornicator does not marry except a fornicator or a polytheist' - he said: These are people who wanted to marry women who were known to be immoral (prostitutes), as they were in the time of ignorance (jahiliyyah). They were told this is forbidden, so when Allah revealed this verse regarding them, Allah made the marriage of such women unlawful. Also narrated: From al-Hasan who said regarding the verse: The fornicator who has been punished for fornication - it is not lawful for him to marry except a woman who has been punished for fornication like him. It is not permissible for him to have something better than her, then the chaste women follow.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding His saying (may He be exalted) 'And let not those of grace and prosperity among you swear' (24:22) - and that is because Abu Bakr al-Siddiq (may Allah be pleased with him) swore that he would not benefit an orphan who was in his guardianship who spread that (about his daughter). When Allah (mighty and exalted) revealed: 'And let not those of grace and prosperity among you swear... Would you not like Allah to forgive you?' (24:22) - Abu Bakr al-Siddiq (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Yes, I love that Allah forgives me, and I will become better to my orphan than I ever was to him.
